title: China grants RMB 6 million for Center for Women and Children Construction Project (Linked to #59165)
description: In 2002, the Chinese government agreed to grant RMB 5,992,882 (or DJF 127,800,007) for the construction of a library and computer room at the Djibouti Center for Women and Children (or Centre Mère et Enfant or 母子中心项目). According to a document from the Djibouti Ministry of Finance (source ID 70690), disbursements began in July 2003 and as of 2005, 100% of the grant funds had been drawn down.   Construction began on 7 January 2003 and the handover ceremony marking project completion was held on 8 January 2004. This ceremony was chaired by the director of the center and was attended by Chinese officials including the Foreign Minister Li Zhaoxing and Ambassador Guan Jindi of the Chinese Embassy in Djibouti.  The donation of equipment for this center is captured in linked project #59165.
combined_text:
# Sector
OTHER SOCIAL INFRASTRUCTURE AND SERVICES

# Title
China grants RMB 6 million for Center for Women and Children Construction Project (Linked to #59165)

# Description
In 2002, the Chinese government agreed to grant RMB 5,992,882 (or DJF 127,800,007) for the construction of a library and computer room at the Djibouti Center for Women and Children (or Centre Mère et Enfant or 母子中心项目). According to a document from the Djibouti Ministry of Finance (source ID 70690), disbursements began in July 2003 and as of 2005, 100% of the grant funds had been drawn down.   Construction began on 7 January 2003 and the handover ceremony marking project completion was held on 8 January 2004. This ceremony was chaired by the director of the center and was attended by Chinese officials including the Foreign Minister Li Zhaoxing and Ambassador Guan Jindi of the Chinese Embassy in Djibouti.  The donation of equipment for this center is captured in linked project #59165.
justification: Project focuses on social infrastructure development without direct environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Construction of library and computer room at Center for Women and Children, social development focus

title: MOFCOM provides $1.8 million interest-free loan for Container Scanner System Project
description: In 2002, the Chinese Government provided an interest-free loan worth approximately $1.8 million to the Government of Djibouti for a Container Scanner System Project. Hualixing Sci-Tech Development Co., Ltd. (北京华力兴科技发展有限责任公司的) — also known as TC-Scan — signed an implementation contract on June 12, 2002 in Beijing.  A launching ceremony for the container scanner system was held on March 5, 2003, and during the ceremony, Hualixing Sci-Tech Development Co., Ltd.'s TC-SCAN container inspection system was officially put to use in the Port of Djibouti. Minister Hassan Houmed Ibrahim of Djibouti and President Liu Bin of Hualixing Sci-Tech Development Co., Ltd signed a project handover certificate on behalf of both parties.
staff_comments: 1. The loan that supported this project is not included in the SAIS-CARI database of Chinese loan commitments that was released in July 2020.1. Since the borrowing terms of the interest-free loan are unavailable, AidData has set the maturity to 20 years by default and grace period to 10 years by default per China's Foreign Assistance White Paper (http://www.cidca.gov.cn/2018-08/06/c_129925064_3.htm) which states that the maturity period of interest-free loans is 20 years, with a drawdown period of 5 years, grace period of 5 years, and repayment over 10 years. AidData treats the drawdown period as providing 5 years of additional grace.3. The Chinese project title is TC-SCAN集装箱检测系统在吉布提. The French project title is Systeme de Controle des Conteneurs de TC-SCAN MSV.
combined_text:
# Sector
TRADE POLICIES AND REGULATIONS

# Title
MOFCOM provides $1.8 million interest-free loan for Container Scanner System Project

# Description
In 2002, the Chinese Government provided an interest-free loan worth approximately $1.8 million to the Government of Djibouti for a Container Scanner System Project. Hualixing Sci-Tech Development Co., Ltd. (北京华力兴科技发展有限责任公司的) — also known as TC-Scan — signed an implementation contract on June 12, 2002 in Beijing.  A launching ceremony for the container scanner system was held on March 5, 2003, and during the ceremony, Hualixing Sci-Tech Development Co., Ltd.'s TC-SCAN container inspection system was officially put to use in the Port of Djibouti. Minister Hassan Houmed Ibrahim of Djibouti and President Liu Bin of Hualixing Sci-Tech Development Co., Ltd signed a project handover certificate on behalf of both parties.
justification: Project focuses on trade security infrastructure without clear environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Container scanner system for port operations, no energy or environmental components mentioned

title: China grants RMB 4.7 million to Djibouti for provision of road equipment in 2002
description: In 2002, the Chinese government granted RMB 4,689,266 (approximately DJF 100,000,004) to the Government Djibouti for acquiring road equipment. Disbursements were supposed to being in January 2003. It is unclear whether these funds were ever disbursed or whether the equipment was ever delivered.
combined_text:
# Sector
TRANSPORT AND STORAGE

# Title
China grants RMB 4.7 million to Djibouti for provision of road equipment in 2002

# Description
In 2002, the Chinese government granted RMB 4,689,266 (approximately DJF 100,000,004) to the Government Djibouti for acquiring road equipment. Disbursements were supposed to being in January 2003. It is unclear whether these funds were ever disbursed or whether the equipment was ever delivered.
justification: Project involves road equipment provision without clear environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Provision of road equipment, no specific environmental or energy-related components mentioned

title: Chinese government grants computers and agricultural equipment worth 20 million RMB to Ecuador through ETCA
description: On September 30 and October 16, 2002, representatives of the governments of China and Ecuador signed and countersigned Letters of Exchange, in which the former agreed to provide the latter equipment worth 20 million RMB (about 2.5 million USD). The grant would be funded through an Economic and Technical Cooperation Agreement (ETCA) signed on May 15, 2001. The full amount provided in this ETCA was used for this project, with banking procedures handled by the Bank of China and Central Bank of Ecuador.   The grant specifically consisted of 120 agricultural tractors (Jimna brand, model JM404); 215 computers (Taiji brand, Pentium 4, including CPU monster, keyboard, mouse, and speakers); 215 printers (laser jet 1000); 23 yellow Steyr dump trucks (model 1291.260/K38/4X2NA); and one school bus (Golden Dragon brand, model XML61000A2, year 2002), to be transported to the port of Guayaquil. Additionally, per the Letters of Exchange, two technical teams from China were to arrive in Ecuador to guide the installation and readjustment of the tractors (for a period of 30 days) and dump trucks (for a period of 20 days).   The handover certificate was signed on July 13, 2003 in Quito.   The beneficiaries of the project were varied. All of the tractors went to the Ministry of Agriculture and Livestock (Ministerio de Agricultura y Ganadería). The school bus went to the Riobamba Higher Technological Institute (Instituto Superior Tecnológico Riobamba).  Of the computers and printers, 30 of each went to the Office of the Vice-presidency, 60 of each to the Ministry of Foreign Relations, 35 of each to the Ministry of Economy and Finances, 30 of each to the Ministry of Foreign Trade, Industrialization, and Fishing, 20 of each to the Rural Social Security (Seguro Social Campesino), 5 of each to the Ministry of Public Works, 5 of each to the Ministry of Education and Culture, 4 of each to the Ministry of Tourism, 5 of each to the Municipality of Cotacachi, 4 of each to the Municipality of Suscal (Cañar), 4 of each to the Municipality of Salitre (Guayas), 2 of each to the Municipality of Echeandia (Bolivar), 2 of each to the Municipality of Orellana (Orellana), 2 of each to the Prefecture of Sucumbios (Nueva Loja), 2 of each to the Municipality of El Chaco (Napo), 2 of each to the Municipality of Tena (Napo), 2 of each to the Municipality of Nabon (Azuay), and 1 of each to the Santísmo Sacramento School (Imbabura).   Of the dump trucks, 4 went to Empresa Emaseo, 1 to the Provincial Council of Carchi, 1 to the Provincial Council of Imbabura, 1 to the Provincial Council of Napo, and 1 to each of the following Municipalities: Napo, Zamora, Esmeraldas, Portovelo (El Oro), Morona Macas, Pelileo (Tungurahua), Daule, Marcelino Mariduena (Guayas), Loja, Puyango (Loja), Atahualpa (El Oro), Cañar, Tosagua (Manabi), Orellana, Guano (Chimborazo), and Milagro.
staff_comments: The ETCA signed on May 15, 2001 is not coded as a separate project, because the full amount provided through it was used for this project. No umbrella project is necessary.
combined_text:
# Sector
OTHER MULTISECTOR

# Title

# Description
On September 30 and October 16, 2002, representatives of the governments of China and Ecuador signed and countersigned Letters of Exchange, in which the former agreed to provide the latter equipment worth 20 million RMB (about 2.5 million USD). The grant would be funded through an Economic and Technical Cooperation Agreement (ETCA) signed on May 15, 2001. The full amount provided in this ETCA was used for this project, with banking procedures handled by the Bank of China and Central Bank of Ecuador.   The grant specifically consisted of 120 agricultural tractors (Jimna brand, model JM404); 215 computers (Taiji brand, Pentium 4, including CPU monster, keyboard, mouse, and speakers); 215 printers (laser jet 1000); 23 yellow Steyr dump trucks (model 1291.260/K38/4X2NA); and one school bus (Golden Dragon brand, model XML61000A2, year 2002), to be transported to the port of Guayaquil. Additionally, per the Letters of Exchange, two technical teams from China were to arrive in Ecuador to guide the installation and readjustment of the tractors (for a period of 30 days) and dump trucks (for a period of 20 days).   The handover certificate was signed on July 13, 2003 in Quito.   The beneficiaries of the project were varied. All of the tractors went to the Ministry of Agriculture and Livestock (Ministerio de Agricultura y Ganadería). The school bus went to the Riobamba Higher Technological Institute (Instituto Superior Tecnológico Riobamba).  Of the computers and printers, 30 of each went to the Office of the Vice-presidency, 60 of each to the Ministry of Foreign Relations, 35 of each to the Ministry of Economy and Finances, 30 of each to the Ministry of Foreign Trade, Industrialization, and Fishing, 20 of each to the Rural Social Security (Seguro Social Campesino), 5 of each to the Ministry of Public Works, 5 of each to the Ministry of Education and Culture, 4 of each to the Ministry of Tourism, 5 of each to the Municipality of Cotacachi, 4 of each to the Municipality of Suscal (Cañar), 4 of each to the Municipality of Salitre (Guayas), 2 of each to the Municipality of Echeandia (Bolivar), 2 of each to the Municipality of Orellana (Orellana), 2 of each to the Prefecture of Sucumbios (Nueva Loja), 2 of each to the Municipality of El Chaco (Napo), 2 of each to the Municipality of Tena (Napo), 2 of each to the Municipality of Nabon (Azuay), and 1 of each to the Santísmo Sacramento School (Imbabura).   Of the dump trucks, 4 went to Empresa Emaseo, 1 to the Provincial Council of Carchi, 1 to the Provincial Council of Imbabura, 1 to the Provincial Council of Napo, and 1 to each of the following Municipalities: Napo, Zamora, Esmeraldas, Portovelo (El Oro), Morona Macas, Pelileo (Tungurahua), Daule, Marcelino Mariduena (Guayas), Loja, Puyango (Loja), Atahualpa (El Oro), Cañar, Tosagua (Manabi), Orellana, Guano (Chimborazo), and Milagro.
justification: Project primarily involves provision of computers, agricultural equipment, and vehicles to various government and educational institutions without clear environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: 120 agricultural tractors, 215 computers, 215 printers, 23 dump trucks, and 1 school bus distributed to government ministries, municipalities, and educational institutions

title: Chinese government grants 50,000 USD in cash to Reventador volcano eruption emergency relief efforts (linked to #87913)
description: On November 28, 2002, Heinz Moeller Freile, from Ecuador's Ministry of Foreign Relations, countersigned Letters of Exchange from Chen Jian, China's Deputy Minister of Foreign Trade and Economic Cooperation, in which the Chinese government agreed to grant the government of Ecuador 5 million RMB (umbrella project captured in project #87913).   In these same letters, 50,000 USD in cash (worth 420,000 RMB) of the 5 million RMB was committed to help with emergency relief efforts related to the November 2002 eruption of the Reventador volcano. The remaining funds went to other economic and technical cooperation projects (see #87913 and #37812). It is unknown when the cash grant was delivered, or what parts of the emergency relief effort it went towards specifically.
combined_text:
# Sector
EMERGENCY RESPONSE

# Title
Chinese government grants 50,000 USD in cash to Reventador volcano eruption emergency relief efforts (linked to #87913)

# Description
On November 28, 2002, Heinz Moeller Freile, from Ecuador's Ministry of Foreign Relations, countersigned Letters of Exchange from Chen Jian, China's Deputy Minister of Foreign Trade and Economic Cooperation, in which the Chinese government agreed to grant the government of Ecuador 5 million RMB (umbrella project captured in project #87913).   In these same letters, 50,000 USD in cash (worth 420,000 RMB) of the 5 million RMB was committed to help with emergency relief efforts related to the November 2002 eruption of the Reventador volcano. The remaining funds went to other economic and technical cooperation projects (see #87913 and #37812). It is unknown when the cash grant was delivered, or what parts of the emergency relief effort it went towards specifically.
justification: Project is focused on emergency relief efforts without clear environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: 50,000 USD cash grant for volcano eruption emergency relief, humanitarian focus

title: Chinese government grants musical instruments worth 1.2 million RMB to Youth Symphony Orchestra Foundation of Ecuador
description: On the President of Ecuador's six day trip to China in March 2002, the Chinese government pledged to grant a batch of musical instruments worth 1.2 million RMB.   On December 12, 2003, the handover certificate for the musical instruments was signed by the Chinese Ambassador and the Ecuadorian Minister of Foreign Relations, and it was specified that the Youth Symphony Orchestra Foundation of Ecuador (Fundación Orquesta Sinfónica Juvenil del Ecuador, FOSJE) would be the beneficiary of the grant.   More specifically, a total of 88 individual instruments, of 26 different types, were granted, including 28 violins, 10 violas, 10 violoncellos, 8 double basses, 4 horns, 3 trombones, and many others.
combined_text:
# Sector
OTHER SOCIAL INFRASTRUCTURE AND SERVICES

# Title
Chinese government grants musical instruments worth 1.2 million RMB to Youth Symphony Orchestra Foundation of Ecuador

# Description
On the President of Ecuador's six day trip to China in March 2002, the Chinese government pledged to grant a batch of musical instruments worth 1.2 million RMB.   On December 12, 2003, the handover certificate for the musical instruments was signed by the Chinese Ambassador and the Ecuadorian Minister of Foreign Relations, and it was specified that the Youth Symphony Orchestra Foundation of Ecuador (Fundación Orquesta Sinfónica Juvenil del Ecuador, FOSJE) would be the beneficiary of the grant.   More specifically, a total of 88 individual instruments, of 26 different types, were granted, including 28 violins, 10 violas, 10 violoncellos, 8 double basses, 4 horns, 3 trombones, and many others.
justification: Project involves donation of musical instruments for cultural development, with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Musical instruments grant to Youth Symphony Orchestra Foundation, cultural development focus

title: Chinese Government provides RMB 30 million grant — via ETCA — for Sino-Egyptian Friendship Model School Construction Project (Linked to ID#72444)
description: On April 20, 2002, China’s Ministry of Commerce (MOFCOM) and Egypt’s Ministry of Investment and International Cooperation signed an Economic and Technical Cooperation Agreement (ETCA), which committed RMB 30 million ($3.75 million) of grant funding for the Sino-Egyptian Friendship Model School Construction Project. This project involved the construction of a school in the 11th district within the 6th of October City (مدينة السادس من أكتوبر) in Giza Governorate. The school has 42 classrooms and a set of laboratories. It occupies an area of 11,268 m^2 and has a floor area of 6,256 m^2. It serves students in kindergarten, primary school, and secondary school.   The ultimate purpose of the project was to promote Chinese language and history education among Egyptian youth. The school also seeks to provide Chinese language instruction so students can compete for jobs as the importance of Chinese language increases within and without Egypt. Additionally, the school seeks to deepen cultural exchanges and trade ties between Egypt and China.   China State Construction Engineering Corporation was the contractor responsible for implementation. Construction commenced on December 18, 2006. The project was completed and the school was officially inaugurated on September 7, 2008. The school was inaugurated with the signature of a cooperation agreement between Egyptian Minister of Investment and International Cooperation, Fayza Abdul-Naga, and Chinese Vice Minister of Commerce Fu Ziying. At the inauguration ceremony, Chinese Ambassador to Egypt Wu Sike, and Egyptian Minister of Education Yosri El-Gamal mentioned that the school was the first to offer Chinese Language instruction in Egypt.   Upon opening, the school accepted an initial class of 87 students from an applicant pool of 1,500. The 87 students were admitted to the school as its first kindergarten class. Tuition ranges between 350 and 1,000 Egyptian Pounds.
staff_comments: 1. This project is also known as the Pilot School for Chinese-Egyptian Friendship Construction Project The Chinese project title is 中文学校项目 or 埃及中国友好示范学校于. The Arabic project title is إنشاء مدرسة الصداقة المصرية الصينية بـ6 أكتوبر or المدرسة الصينية or المدرسة النموذجية للصداقة المصرية الصينية.
combined_text:
# Sector
EDUCATION

# Title
Chinese Government provides RMB 30 million grant — via ETCA — for Sino-Egyptian Friendship Model School Construction Project (Linked to ID#72444)

# Description
On April 20, 2002, China’s Ministry of Commerce (MOFCOM) and Egypt’s Ministry of Investment and International Cooperation signed an Economic and Technical Cooperation Agreement (ETCA), which committed RMB 30 million ($3.75 million) of grant funding for the Sino-Egyptian Friendship Model School Construction Project. This project involved the construction of a school in the 11th district within the 6th of October City (مدينة السادس من أكتوبر) in Giza Governorate. The school has 42 classrooms and a set of laboratories. It occupies an area of 11,268 m^2 and has a floor area of 6,256 m^2. It serves students in kindergarten, primary school, and secondary school.   The ultimate purpose of the project was to promote Chinese language and history education among Egyptian youth. The school also seeks to provide Chinese language instruction so students can compete for jobs as the importance of Chinese language increases within and without Egypt. Additionally, the school seeks to deepen cultural exchanges and trade ties between Egypt and China.   China State Construction Engineering Corporation was the contractor responsible for implementation. Construction commenced on December 18, 2006. The project was completed and the school was officially inaugurated on September 7, 2008. The school was inaugurated with the signature of a cooperation agreement between Egyptian Minister of Investment and International Cooperation, Fayza Abdul-Naga, and Chinese Vice Minister of Commerce Fu Ziying. At the inauguration ceremony, Chinese Ambassador to Egypt Wu Sike, and Egyptian Minister of Education Yosri El-Gamal mentioned that the school was the first to offer Chinese Language instruction in Egypt.   Upon opening, the school accepted an initial class of 87 students from an applicant pool of 1,500. The 87 students were admitted to the school as its first kindergarten class. Tuition ranges between 350 and 1,000 Egyptian Pounds.
justification: Project focuses on education and cultural exchange without direct environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: School construction for Chinese language education, cultural exchange focus, no energy-related components mentioned

title: Chinese Government provides $6 million interest-free loan for Malabo Television Center Construction Project
description: In 2002, China’s Ministry of Commerce and the Government of Equatorial Guinea signed a $6 interest-free loan agreement for the Malabo Television Center Construction Project. The borrower was expected to use the proceeds of the loan to finance a contract between the Government of Equatorial Guinea and Dalian International Corporation, which was signed on November 5, 2002.   This project involved the construction of the headquarters building for the state-run radio and television company, Radio Televisión de Guinea Ecuatorial (RTVGE), in Malabo. On December 13, 2004, Dalian International Corporation signed a project implementation agreement with China’s Ministry of Commerce. Construction began on August 28, 2005. Then, on August 31, 2005, Ms. Plyfi Cassio Opo Barilla, Secretary of State for News, Radio and Television, and Secretary-General Ramon Bengono led the Director of Information and other relevant personnel to inspect the project. Construction ended in September 2006. The project was officially handed over to the Equatorial Guinean Government on January 2, 2007.
staff_comments: 1. This project is also known as the National Television Center Construction Project and the RTVGE Construction Project. The Chinese project title is 马拉博电视中心目 or 援赤几马拉博电视中心项目 or 援赤几马拉博电视中心项目 or 赤道几内亚马拉博广播电视中心. The Spanish project title is Centro de Televisión de Malabo or Rehabilitacion del edificio sede de la Radio Television Guinea Ecuatorial en Malabo or Eel proyecto de ayuda en la Construcción del Centro de Televisión de Guinea Ecuatorial, Malabo. 2. Since the borrowing terms of the interest-free loan are unavailable, AidData has set maturity period to 20 years by default and grace period to 10 years by default per China's Foreign Assistance White Paper (http://www.cidca.gov.cn/2018-08/06/c_129925064_3.htm) which states that the maturity period of interest-free loans is 20 years, with a drawdown period of 5 years, grace period of 5 years, and repayment over 10 years. AidData treats the drawdown period as providing 5 years of additional grace. 3. According to the Autonomous Fund for Amortization of Public Debt (Caja Autónoma de Amortización de la Deuda Pública) within Equatorial Guinea’s Ministry of Finance and Budget, the Chinese Government provided an RMB 11,500,000 interest-free loan — through an Economic and Technical Cooperation (ECTA)— for an unspecified purpose on October 21, 2002. The loan had fully disbursed as of December 31, 2019. The borrower had not made any interest or principal repayments as of December 31, 2019. However, it is unclear if the proceeds of this loan were used to partially support the Malabo Television Center Construction Project. This issue warrants further investigation. 4. The contract that was signed on November 5, 2002 is known as the Contrato de diseño del proyecto de ayuda en la Construcción del Centro de Televisión de Guinea Ecuatorial, Malabo.
combined_text:
# Sector
COMMUNICATIONS

# Title
Chinese Government provides $6 million interest-free loan for Malabo Television Center Construction Project

# Description
In 2002, China’s Ministry of Commerce and the Government of Equatorial Guinea signed a $6 interest-free loan agreement for the Malabo Television Center Construction Project. The borrower was expected to use the proceeds of the loan to finance a contract between the Government of Equatorial Guinea and Dalian International Corporation, which was signed on November 5, 2002.   This project involved the construction of the headquarters building for the state-run radio and television company, Radio Televisión de Guinea Ecuatorial (RTVGE), in Malabo. On December 13, 2004, Dalian International Corporation signed a project implementation agreement with China’s Ministry of Commerce. Construction began on August 28, 2005. Then, on August 31, 2005, Ms. Plyfi Cassio Opo Barilla, Secretary of State for News, Radio and Television, and Secretary-General Ramon Bengono led the Director of Information and other relevant personnel to inspect the project. Construction ended in September 2006. The project was officially handed over to the Equatorial Guinean Government on January 2, 2007.
justification: Project involves construction of media center without clear environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Construction of headquarters building for state-run radio and television company, no energy-related components mentioned
